items.title: Robert Donald Blackberry jailed after hay bale scam targeting Tasmanian farmers
items.summary: A judge blasts a man's "complete and utter disregard for the law" and jails him for scamming farmers desperate for feed out of money for hay bales he never delivered.

items.title: Woman treated for suspected bite after eastern brown snake became trapped in her shoe
items.summary: A woman has been rushed to hospital after a brown snake curled around her leg, becoming trapped in her shoe.

items.title: Queensland government report describes 'perfect storm of risk' in school exam bungle
items.summary: The Queensland government has released a report into how the wrong Ancient History content was taught to Year 12 students at nine schools.

items.title: CommBank reverses refusal to refund $68m in excessive fees for low-income earners
items.summary: The Commonwealth Bank of Australia will refund low-income earners receiving Centrelink payments approximately $68 million in unfair fees — just over a quarter of what was charged.

items.title: Up to 1,700 jobs axed days out from Christmas as security firm MA Services collapses
items.summary: A "significant number" of employees have been made immediately redundant as MA Security — which provides security and maintenance services to major retailers like Coles, Kmart and Amazon — enters administration.

items.title: Melbourne faces its coldest Christmas weather in two decades — but Victoria's summer heat is on its way
items.summary: Temperatures in the Victorian capital are unlikely to climb past 17 degrees on Christmas Day, but the state will swing back to some warm to hot days ahead of the new year.

items.title: Delta Electricity found guilty over 2022 fish kill near its Vales Point Power Station
items.summary: A court rules a maintenance failure caused hundreds of fish to die near Delta Electricity's Vales Point coal-fired power station in September 2022, a month after another kill triggered by natural causes.

items.title: Dead fish found at Lake Macquarie in 2022
items.summary: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

items.title: NSW police officer Jack Hibbert released from hospital after being shot in Bondi terror attack
items.summary: A young police officer who was rendered blind in one eye after being shot during the Bondi terror attack is released from hospital.

items.title: Pat Cummins could miss T20 World Cup to manage back injury
items.summary: Pat Cummins could be held back from the upcoming T20 World Cup as Australia look to manage his workload following his recent back injury.

items.title: ECB managing director Rob Key to investigate England's Noosa break following Ashes failure
items.summary: ECB managing director Rob Key will investigate reports England's recent break in Noosa resembled a "stag do" as the tourists pick up the pieces from their Ashes defeat.

items.title: Severe Christmas heatwave scorches WA as Tropical Cyclone Grant strengthens offshore
items.summary: Perth, and much of WA, is enduring a severe Christmas heatwave with extreme fire danger, while Tropical Cyclone Grant intensifies offshore.

items.title: NSW oyster growers face contrasting holiday seasons as Christmas Eve rush looms
items.summary: The Christmas oyster harvest is flourishing on the NSW south coast, but further north it is a very different story as growers face the fallout of this year's record-breaking floods.

items.title: What the weather will bring in your capital city on Christmas Day
items.summary: It is just a few sleeps until Christmas Day, and the weather is promising a mixed bag for Australia's capital cities. Here is what to expect.

items.title: Christmas shoppers fight the crowds to finish celebration preparations
items.summary: Australians flock to markets, shops and stores across the country in a last-minute rush to prepare for Christmas.

items.title: Canterbury-Bankstown Council shuts down prayer hall linked to notorious preacher Wissam Haddad
items.summary: The City of Canterbury Bankstown Council says the site had been approved for use as a medical centre.

items.title: Therapeutic Goods Administration issues warnings over heavy metals in Ayurvedic tablets
items.summary: Australia's medicine watchdog has issued another safety alert for contaminated Ayurvedic medicines. So what do consumers need to know about this multi-million-dollar industry?

items.title: No air conditioning in Shellharbour Hospital ward during heatwave
items.summary: Patients swelter in an Illawarra hospital ward after an air conditioning unit fails during a heatwave.

items.title: As a newly single mum, I am redefining Christmas with my kids
items.summary: This is my first Christmas as a single mum where I will wake up without my son in the home. I won't be watching him excitedly tear into presents. It's not easy, but there's also some relief, writes Catherine.

items.title: Best podcasts of 2025, from Forged to Fela Kuti: Fear No Man
items.summary: Our favourite podcasts of the year include tales of art forgery, a documentary about the life of Fela Kútì and a true-crime thriller about a dead body in the ocean.

items.title: Gregory John Walker jailed over Arthur Haines' death after 1998 Sydney firebombing
items.summary: Gregory John Walker is sentenced to at least six-and-a-half years in prison for unlawfully killing a teenager by firebombing a Sydney home in 1998 during an escalating neighbourhood dispute.

items.title: Koala protection in south-east Queensland to be shaped by new strategy
items.summary: The Queensland government is inviting the public to have their say on a new strategy to protect the south-east's koala population.

items.title: Anthony Albanese recommends changes to parliamentarians' travel rules
items.summary: Under the recommendations, family of parliamentarians would be restricted to economy class flights and an allowance for three annual "Australia-wide" return trips would be scrapped.

items.title: Boy rescued after falling from cliff at Sorrento on the Mornington Peninsula
items.summary: The teenager suffered leg injuries after falling three metres from a clifftop on the Mornington Peninsula.

items.title: Latest 'Battle of the sexes' commodifies and risks mocking historic event
items.summary: Aryna Sabalenka and Nick Kygrios' match marketed under the "Battle of the Sexes" banner makes a mockery of first era-defining match between Billie Jean King and Bobby Riggs.

items.title: Activist groups flag constitutional challenge to proposed NSW protest restrictions
items.summary: Three prominent protest groups flag they will launch a constitutional challenge to NSW Premier Chris Minns's new laws restricting protests in the state.

items.title: Judge accepts guilty pleas from Colorado funeral home owners for abuse of 191 corpses
items.summary: Authorities say Colorado funeral home operators Carie and Jon Hallford gave fake ashes to some families of the dead.

items.title: Central West horticulturist supplying Australia's Christmas trees
items.summary: From a backyard in Wollongong to a booming farm in the NSW Central West, Christmas trees are big business for Lawrence Ranson.

items.title: Woman appears in court after failing to 'keep the King's Peace' and allegedly biting ACT police officer's leg
items.summary: A failure to 'keep the King's Peace' and biting a police officer has almost landed a Canberra woman in jail for Christmas.

items.title: Rain-hit orchards still producing 'best quality' lychees in time for Christmas
items.summary: After season constraints and rain-delayed harvests, this summer is producing exceptional Queensland lychees, according to the wholesalers.

items.title: Historic giant sequoia tree in Hobart's St David's Park 'very, very sick' after fires and vandalism
items.summary: An 88-year-young giant sequoia tree is "declining rapidly" in St David's Park in central Hobart due to a range of disturbances, including vandalism and fire, the council says.

items.title: Newmont's Cadia Gold Mine to spend $300,000 on monitors after dust incidents
items.summary: One of the country's largest gold mines in the NSW Central West will buy five new dust monitors after incidents at its tailings dam.

items.title: Bondi Beach shooting updates: NSW premier defends protest laws, saying 'words lead to actions'
items.summary: Chris Minns says new protest laws will be introduced despite "resistance to the government's legislative agenda in recent days".

items.title: Ferrari crash reportedly kills Call of Duty co-founder Vince Zampella in California
items.summary: Vince Zampella has died after a crash on a scenic road north of Los Angeles, according to local broadcaster NBC4.

items.title: Despite warnings from Donald Trump, the push for Israeli control over the West Bank continues
items.summary: Despite US President Donald Trump's objections to the annexation of the West Bank, new settlement projects are approved, with some Israelis excited while Palestinians are left fearful.

items.title: Man sentenced to home detention after hiring crane to damage Mount Gambier home
items.summary: A Mount Gambier man is sentenced after hiring a crane and partially destroying another man's home.

items.title: The Alice Springs disability enterprise delivering mail to Aboriginal town camps
items.summary: A disability enterprise is partnering with Australia Post to deliver mail to Aboriginal town camps around Alice Springs.

items.title: Ashes 2025: Pat Cummins, Nathan Lyon out of Boxing Day Test, Jhye Richardson and Todd Murphy in squad
items.summary: West Australian fast bowler Jhye Richardson comes into Australia's squad for the fourth Ashes Test, while Victorian off spinner Todd Murphy has been named, and is a chance to play his eighth match and first on Australian soil.

items.title: Serie A soccer game between AC Milan and Como at Perth Stadium called off
items.summary: A historic Serie A soccer clash between AC Milan and Como at Perth Stadium in February is called off, with sanctions imposed by the Asian Football Confederation blamed for making it "impossible".

items.title: Residents of The Rock, in southern NSW, take on businesses to keep town alive
items.summary: After giving to her community for decades, Barb's town is now working hard so people like her never have to leave for necessities.

items.title: Plans to burn red tingle trees temporarily suspended following treetop protest
items.summary: The WA government abandons plans to burn a parcel of forest that is home to a species of rare tree after a 70-year-old man spent six nights living in the canopy.

items.title: Bonnie Deas putting WNBL lessons to use in US college basketball with University of Arkansas
items.summary: Bonnie Deas is shining in US college basketball, and she puts a lot of her success down to a WNBL semifinal trial by fire against Australian basketball great Sami Whitcomb.

items.title: Donald Trump sparks Denmark's anger by appointing US envoy to Greenland
items.summary: US President Donald Trump appoints a special envoy to Greenland, drawing renewed criticism from Denmark and the territory's leader over Washington's interest in the mineral-rich Arctic island.

items.title: In a 'complete 180', graziers get early Christmas present with significant rainfall
items.summary: The heavy rainfall is welcomed by graziers and follows months of dry conditions in the state's far-west, with hot temperatures and wind battering the land.

items.title: Thunderstorm arrives in Broken Hill ahead of Christmas.
items.summary: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

items.title: Poor sleep, unhealthy diets and stress compound to leave homeless at risk of dying decades early
items.summary: Western Australian research is showing a strong link between homelessness and poor health, with life expectancy more than 30 years lower for people without secure housing.

items.title: WA's water regulator is probing South32's impacts on neighbouring farmland
items.summary: The owner of a farm neighbouring South32's major bauxite mine in WA claims the miner is responsible for rising salinity and reduced water availability at his property. His claims are now being probed by WA's regulator.

items.title: Caravans left unattended at free riverside campsite spark debate over fair access
items.summary: Unattended caravans line a popular Murray River campsite, triggering debate over whether public camping spots are being quietly claimed ahead of the busy holiday season.

items.title: Cross-border commissioner's death leaves border towns in limbo
items.summary: Towns, like Goondiwindi on the Queensland-New South Wales border, wait to see who will replace the late Ian Leavers in the role of cross-border commissioner and continue his work.

items.title: What are you really paying when using a card this Christmas?
items.summary: Cashless payments make up about three-quarters of all transactions in Australia but come at a cost to both merchants and consumers, leaving some asking if it is time to consider it essential infrastructure.

items.title: CBA reverses decision not to refund overcharged low-income customers, RBA eyes rate hikes — as it happened
items.summary: CBA backflips on decision not to refund low-income customers who were charged excessive fees. Meanwhile, the RBA is assessing the need for higher interest rates while gold pushes to record high. Follow the day's events and insights from our business reporters on the ABC News live markets blog.

items.title: The Epstein files divided Trump's base and now more fights are brewing
items.summary: The release of the Epstein files followed some of Donald Trump's dedicated supporters launching a rare revolt against the US president. Here are six more issues that could also divide Republicans.

items.title: Wild Christmas week ahead for Queensland with days of severe storms forecast as temperatures ease
items.summary: The weather bureau is forecasting heavy rainfall and thunderstorms for large parts of the state over the Christmas week, but temperatures are expected to ease.

items.title: Swiss court to hear Pari islanders' climate change case against cement giant Holcim
items.summary: Residents of the tiny Indonesian island of Pari, which risks being swallowed by rising seas, win the right to have their climate change case against cement giant Holcim heard in a Swiss court.

items.title: Russian general Fanil Sarvarov killed by car bomb in Moscow, officials say
items.summary: The Kremlin is probing who is behind the killing, which has similarities to previous attacks by Ukrainian special services.

items.title: Thousands of birds are dying on a remote island with no end in sight
items.summary: The Isle of May is the epicentre of a deadly outbreak of the H5N1 bird flu strain which has spread throughout the globe. Scientists are warning Australia could be next.

items.title: Driving Home for Christmas singer Chris Rea dies aged 74
items.summary: The man best known for his festive hit Driving Home for Christmas died surrounded by his family.

items.title: Sisters in Sweat — the Sunday football session that grew a sporting movement of over 15,000 Indian women
items.summary: Eight years ago, Swetha Subbiah was asked to run a single football session for a friend. She ended up starting a sporting movement, which now has 15,000 women and girls as members across Bengaluru, Mumbai, Hyderabad and Delhi.

items.title: Liberal-linked Tasmanian public relations firm Font PR shuts
items.summary: It has helped keep the Liberals in power in Tasmania and lobbied on behalf of Airbnb, the salmon industry and the Catholic Church — but the PR firm, described as having "fingers in a lot of pies", is closing down.

items.title: A chaotic 'up-crash' as markets and economic realities made for a turbulent 2025
items.summary: AI. Market records. Tariffs. Penguins. TACO. It's been a big year of economic shocks and surges as the international framework of global trade was shredded. Here's how key players saw the year that was.

items.title: World's largest warship looms near Venezuela as US warns of land attacks
items.summary: The Pentagon moved the USS Gerald R Ford, the world's largest aircraft carrier, to the Caribbean last month. Now, President Donald Trump is repeating threats of imminent strikes against Venezuelan territory.

items.title: Beekeepers on high alert as bee-killing varroa mite spreads in South Australia
items.summary: The varroa mite may be tiny — only a millimetre or two long — but it poses a huge threat to honey bees, beekeepers and honey producers, who are on high alert after the destructive mite's recent arrival in South Australia.

items.title: Videos and CCTV give fresh insight into gunmen's plot to target Bondi Beach
items.summary: Security camera footage captured the Bondi Beach gunmen carrying what appears to be firearms out of a south-west Sydney property on the morning of the terror attack, court documents reveal.

items.title: Better late than never: The gas fix to a problem that should never have been
items.summary: The gas export industry has cost the nation dearly. East coast prices trebled soon after exports began.

items.title: Stephen Cubis was the face of GIM Trading when investors lost millions but his story began long before then
items.summary: Stephen Cubis hides behind a charming facade, but his former lover and friends say the career con man ruined them financially and emotionally long before he was caught up in allegations of a multi-million-dollar fraud.

items.title: Unhinged Christmas movies quiz: Can you pick the real movies from these ridiculous plots?
items.summary: Once December rolls around, there's nothing the minor movie studios love more than getting their most unhinged Christmas tropes out of cold storage.

items.title: Today in History, December 23: Uruguay legalises recreational cannabis use
items.summary: Twelve years ago today, Uruguay became the first country to legalise recreational marijuana use. The experiment is still unfolding.

items.title: Fire Rescue Victoria sues United Firefighters Union over $1.6m in taxpayer-funded 'service fees'
items.summary: Taxpayers have funded $1.6 million in payments to the firefighters union via Fire Rescue Victoria, court documents allege, under an income protection scheme the state's fire chief has said should outrage all Victorians.

items.title: Man behind deadly Taiwan metro attack planned it for over a year
items.summary: Police in Taiwan say Chang Wen purchased grenades, gas canisters and respirators in the year leading up to Friday's attack.

items.title: Uber and Lyft partner with Chinese tech giant for self-driving cars in London
items.summary: Rideshare companies Uber and Lyft are planning to bring self-driving cars to the streets of London in the first half of 2026.

items.title: Thailand and Cambodia set to resume ceasefire negotiations amid deadly border conflict
items.summary: Bangkok says the two countries will return to the negotiating table this week amid claims the initial peace deal was rushed for Donald Trump.

items.title: Kyrgios not offered Australian Open wildcard as four other Aussies named
items.summary: After a career-best year, Queenslander Priscilla Hon was among four Australian Open wildcards named on Monday, but Nick Kyrgios was not among them.

items.title: Three bushwalkers rescued from Lake Rhona in Tasmania's south-west
items.summary: Three "cold and wet but otherwise uninjured" bushwalkers have been airlifted out of Tasmania's remote south-west after calling for help.

items.title: Man charged after death at Big 4 Port Willunga caravan park in Adelaide's south
items.summary: A 49-year-old man has appeared in court charged with the alleged murder of 72-year-old Gary Hallam at the Big 4 Port Willunga Tourist Park at Aldinga in Adelaide's south on Monday.

items.title: Glenelg beachside retail precinct reopens after tumultuous period for businesses
items.summary: Traders along one of Adelaide's most popular beachside dining and retail strips have welcomed the reopening of roads to traffic, but say recovery will take time.

items.title: Festive season to bring Christmas Day heatwave to Perth and Cocos Island tropical cyclone
items.summary: Perth is expected to hit a high of 41 degrees on Christmas Day with the Cocos (Keeling) Islands bracing for a tropical cyclone that could intensify to a category two system.

items.title: Japan prepares to restart world's biggest nuclear plant, 15 years after Fukushima
items.summary: Japan has taken the final step to allow the world's largest nuclear power plant to resume operations with a regional vote in Niigata prefecture.

items.title: City Beach fined $14m by Federal Court over button battery safety breaches
items.summary: The Federal Court orders the fashion retailer to pay $14 million in fines after it was taken to court by the Australian Competition and Consumer Commission.

items.title: Racing tribunal bans greyhound trainer Gerry Orr for six years over prohibited substances
items.summary: Victorian trainer Gerry Orr has received a six-year ban for procuring performance-enhancing drugs after he inadvertently alerted stewards by giving authorities his mobile phone.

items.title: Should I pour leftover liquids or foods down the sink?

items.summary: The NSW Coroners Court hands down findings into the 2023 death of a young Indigenous mother after a doctor gave evidence the woman may have died from "broken-heart syndrome".

items.title: Stuart Broad still believes Australia's Ashes-winning team is their worst side in 15 years
items.summary: Stuart Broad has attracted plenty of criticism for his low opinion of the current Australian team but the England great stands by his harsh assessment.

items.summary: Artists like Stella Donnelly are searching for ways to cut waste and make production of their albums environmentally friendly.

items.title: Alleged racial hatred event organiser Ryder Shaw refused bail

items.title: Why Mitchell Starc is open to playing on to the 2027 Ashes series

items.summary: The number of measles cases nationwide is now approaching triple the number of cases reported in 2024 as outbreaks continue around the world.

items.title: Bondi gunmen filmed 'firearms training' and threw explosives into crowd, court told
items.summary: The Bondi gunman accused of killing 15 people conducted "firearms training" in a regional area with his father and recorded a video about their "justification" for the attack, according to documents released by a Sydney court.

items.title: Building a village means showing up even when it feels hard, says Esther Perel
items.summary: Building and maintaining a village doesn't just happen. It takes effort. It means showing up even when it feels hard or inconvenient, says psychotherapist Esther Perel.

items.title: Lake George hides an earthquake fault zone, and scientists are using your road noise to see it
items.summary: Almost 100 sensors beside the Federal Highway are helping build the clearest picture yet of the fault beneath the iconic lake.

items.title: Government confirms plans for gas reservation on east coast

items.title: Seven injured as car crashes into Royal Hotel Capertee, near Lithgow

items.title: Former chief justice urges national Bondi terror attack royal commission
items.summary: Calls for the federal government to hold a royal commission into the Bondi terror attack continue after NSW announced intentions for a state-level royal commission, prompting some confusion about the difference.

items.title: Zdravko 'Zed' Bilic's legacy to live on through youth sport initiative
items.summary: The wife of the beloved soccer coach, who died during a home invasion, wants to help break the cycle of youth crime through sport.

items.summary: NSW parliament looks likely to pass what would be the strictest gun laws in Australia.

items.summary: A renewable energy project being built at one of Western Australia's biggest gold mines has been transformed into a unique canvas for an Indigenous artist and about 200 schoolchildren.

items.title: Calls for urgent intervention to help Victorian teachers find affordable housing
items.summary: Victorian teachers say they are exhausted, living almost 100 kilometres from work, as their salaries fail to sustain housing costs.

items.title: James Ransone, star of The Wire and It: Chapter Two, dies at age 46
items.summary: James Ransone, an actor best known for playing Ziggy Sobotka in The Wire and also starring in It: Chapter Two, has died, according to LA medical authorities.

items.title: Seasonal workers claim unfair bonus cuts and poor conditions on NSW cherry orchard
items.summary: Ten pickers who worked at Hallmark Cherries' orchard in NSW complain about poorly maintained accommodation and failure to pay an end-of-season bonus.

items.summary: Hobart star Nikhil Chaudhary launches a ball onto the roof of Kardinia Park in Geelong, but his 79 off 38 is still not enough to earn him player of the match honours in the win over the Renegades.

items.summary: The small Victorian town of Ouyen, 440 kilometres north-west of Melbourne, is known for its grain and sheep farms, but also for being "dementia friendly".

items.summary: Transitioning from "the happiest nation on earth" to a fast-paced Western society is not without its challenges for Perth's booming Bhutanese population, some of whom have taken up archery to improve their mental health.

items.title: Man charged with murder after woman's death at Northfield

items.title: Heavily armed specialist police to patrol MCG during Boxing Day Test

items.title: High school students forced to fight false allegations of AI cheating
items.summary: Pulled out of class, held back after school and forced to prove they're not AI cheats, students say NSW high schools are pitting them against faulty AI detectors.

items.summary: Nathan Lyon's injury leaves selectors with another headache, made trickier by Pat Cummins's admission that he will almost certainly miss the Boxing Day Test now that the Ashes are won.

items.title: Given the all clear from cancer, 6yo Laylah celebrates by ringing the bell at the Queensland Children's Hospital
items.summary: When six-year-old Laylah-Jane Morton rang the bell at the Queensland Children's Hospital, it marked the end of her chemotherapy treatment for blood cancer — and she had her merry band of eight siblings with her to help her celebrate.

items.title: How domestic violence offenders use the court system to inflict more pain
items.summary: Jessica Seage fought for six years for the man who raped her to be convicted. Experts say her experience is a stark example of how perpetrators abuse the system to inflict more pain on their victims.

items.title: Long-awaited wine industry mandatory code of conduct too late for growers
items.summary: After 20 years, three senate inquiries and an independent review, the sale of wine grapes will be regulated by a mandatory code of conduct, but growers say it might be too late.

items.summary: If successful, it would be the third oil tanker seized as Donald Trump continues his campaign on President Nicolas Maduro.

items.title: England's Bazballers finally admit they've got things wrong in this Ashes series
items.summary: Losing an Ashes Test series in Australia is nothing new for England, but finally the Bazballers are looking inwards at their own failings after a stirring end to the Adelaide Test.

items.title: Insolvent business run by former AFL star wipes its debt of millions, and the taxpayer is left to foot the bill
items.summary: A digital marketing agency run by a former AFL star has wiped its millions in debt through an insolvency process, only to open under a new ABN days later. Former staff were left without a job and almost $450,000 in unpaid entitlements, but it's within the bounds of the law and leaves taxpayers footing the bill.

items.summary: Pluribus, the new show from Breaking Bad and Better Call Saul creator Vince Gilligan, presents a life of perfect harmony — all you have to do is give up your individuality.

items.title: Nathan Lyon injured on fifth day of Adelaide Test as England hunt a miracle to keep Ashes series alive
